main event: A bright, luminous object about the size of an F-86 aircraft was sighted by a pilot and crew over Spangdahlem AFB, Germany in 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as a sphere about 72 feet in diameter, emitting a white luminous glow followed by a black smoke contrail.
The object appeared about 45 degrees below the aircraft at the 10 o'clock position and flew a straight and level path on the same heading as the aircraft.
The sighting lasted for approximately 10 minutes and was observed by multiple qualified and rated crew members, who were considered reliable witnesses.
The object moved rapidly, changing heading from 336 to 210 degrees, and the reported shape varied from different observer positions.
The intelligence officer and weather data could not conclusively explain the sighting as a meteorological or ballistic phenomenon, and it was considered an unexplained UFO sighting.
sighted object: a bright, luminous sphere about 72 feet in diameter
witnesses: pilot and crew of an RB-66 aircraft
